SEARCH
Package com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.model

Class Card

java.lang.Object
com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.model.Card
@Entity public class Card extends Object
Represents a trading card entity stored in the database.

This class is mapped to a database table and contains fields for metadata like game, name, rarity, price, and publication dates. It is annotated for use with JPA (Jakarta Persistence) and includes validation constraints.

Author: Timothy Butler
Course: CEN 3024 - Software Development 1
Date: July 13, 2025

    The date the card was purchased.

    dateSetPublished
    The official publication date of the card’s set.
    private boolean
    foiled
    Indicates whether the card is foiled (shiny).

    id
    Primary key for the card, auto-generated by the database.
    private @Positive BigDecimal
    purchasePrice
    The price the user paid for the card.
    private CardRarity
    rarity
    The rarity classification of the card (e.g., COMMON, LEGENDARY).

  • Field Details

    • id

      private Long id
      Primary key for the card, auto-generated by the database.

    • cardNumber

      @Positive private @jakarta.validation.constraints.Positive int cardNumber
      The unique card number within the collection.

    • cardGame

      @NotBlank private @NotBlank String cardGame
      The name of the game this card belongs to (e.g., Magic, Pokémon).

    • cardName

      @NotBlank private @NotBlank String cardName
      The name of the card.

    • rarity

      private CardRarity rarity
      The rarity classification of the card (e.g., COMMON, LEGENDARY).

    • datePurchased

      @PastOrPresent private @PastOrPresent LocalDate datePurchased
      The date the card was purchased. Must be in the past or present.

    • dateSetPublished

      @PastOrPresent private @PastOrPresent LocalDate dateSetPublished
      The official publication date of the card’s set.

    • purchasePrice

      @Positive private @Positive BigDecimal purchasePrice
      The price the user paid for the card.

    • foiled

      private boolean foiled
      Indicates whether the card is foiled (shiny).

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card()
      Default constructor required by JPA.

    • Card

      public Card(int cardNumber, String cardGame, String cardName, CardRarity rarity, LocalDate datePurchased, LocalDate dateSetPublished, BigDecimal purchasePrice, boolean foiled)
      Constructs a Card without an ID, for insert operations.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - the unique card number
      cardGame - the game name
      cardName - the card's name
      rarity - the card's rarity
      datePurchased - the purchase date
      dateSetPublished - the set's publication date
      purchasePrice - the price paid
      foiled - whether the card is foiled

    • Card

      public Card(Long id, int cardNumber, String cardGame, String cardName, CardRarity rarity, LocalDate datePurchased, LocalDate dateSetPublished, BigDecimal purchasePrice, boolean foiled)
      Constructs a Card with an ID, used for updating or querying existing entries.
      Parameters:
      id - the database ID
      cardNumber - the unique card number
      cardGame - the game name
      cardName - the card's name
      rarity - the card's rarity
      datePurchased - the purchase date
      dateSetPublished - the set's publication date
      purchasePrice - the price paid
      foiled - whether the card is foiled
